abstract: The unit, AIG Rail Services, is based in Chicago and has more than 10,000 rail cars and leases. Potential buyers could include buyout firms.
snippet: The unit, AIG Rail Services, is based in Chicago and has more than 10,000 rail cars and leases. Potential buyers could include buyout firms.
lead_paragraph: 6:47 p.m. | Updated The American International Group is shopping around its rail-car unit, a person with knowledge of the matter said on Sunday. The move would be part of the insurer’s effort to sell noncore businesses to pay down its $130 billion taxpayer-financed bailout.

headline.main: A.I.G. Puts Rail-Car Unit on Auction Block

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
